meta.title: The Crimson Seagull and the Burning Ember Crown
meta.author: Original

intro.text: Salt wind bites your lips as the Crimson Seagull cuts through dark water. Ahead, a sky like bruised velvet hangs over an island that shouldn’t exist—yet there it is, crowned in emberlight.

choices.label: Order full sail toward the island

full_sail.text: The crew moves fast. The sea changes color as you approach, black turning to molten red beneath the surface as if the ocean remembers fire.

choices.label: Keep everyone aboard and anchor off-shore

cautious_circle.text: You circle once. Twice. No birds. No waves breaking on the rocks. The silence feels deliberate, like a trap with manners.

choices.label: Send a single skiff to scout

landing.text: Boots hit ash-colored sand. The air smells of warm metal. In the distance, something glows—like a crown set on a stone throne.

anchor_offshore.text: You anchor and wait. The island doesn’t move, doesn’t call. But the emberlight seems to pulse, as if it has a heartbeat that matches your own.

skiff_scout.text: The skiff glides in. For a moment you lose sight of it behind a jagged rock. When it returns, the scout won’t meet your eyes—and keeps rubbing ash from their palms.

choices.label: Land with the whole crew now

ember_path.text: The path climbs through cracked stone. Heat rises from beneath, gentle at first, then intimate—like a hand on your neck.

shore_signs.text: You find footprints that don’t match any boot you know, pressed deep into ash like they were made by something heavier than a person should be.

ending_good_crown_seen.text: You reach a ridge and see it—an Ember Crown, hovering above a stone altar, burning without fuel. The island isn’t a place. It’s a trial. And it has finally begun.

ending.summary: You find the Ember Crown’s resting place and begin the true quest.

ending_ambiguous_warning.text: You pause. The crew watches you for a decision that will become legend or regret. The emberlight pulses again, patient as fate.

ending.summary: You delay the inevitable. The island waits, and so does the Crown.

ending_bad_followed.text: You follow the footprints until the ash becomes too deep, then suddenly nothing—no sound, no wind, no crew behind you. Only emberlight and the feeling you’ve been separated on purpose.

ending.summary: You’re isolated by the island’s magic. The Crown’s trial turns hostile.
